title: Unblemished test animal with two hairs
vignette: Inspectors find two black hairs on a nearly perfect test animal.

options.text: Disqualify it from use for material preparation.
Two hairs are insignificant; still valid.

title: Test animal owned jointly by partners
vignette: Two families purchase a test animal together.

options.text: It must belong entirely to the community treasury.
Joint ownership is acceptable if both consent.

title: Animal worked briefly by mistake
vignette: The test animal was led with a yoke for a few minutes before anyone noticed.

options.text: Any work disqualifies it completely.
Such minor use can be overlooked.

title: Processing outside the main facility
vignette: The test animal is processed at the designated site rather than inside the main facility.

options.text: This is correct; it must be outside the main facility.
Better to process inside for efficiency.

title: Material missing from the required set
vignette: Preparers cannot find one of the required materials for mixing with the preparation.

options.text: Proceed with the available materials only.
Delay until all required materials are ready.

title: Material stored in a metal container
vignette: Protocol prefers ceramic containers but only metal ones are available.

options.text: Metal containers are acceptable in a pinch.
Use ceramic only even if it causes delay.

title: Contact with hazardous material during preparation
vignette: One of the assistants preparing the material is exposed to a hazardous substance.

options.text: The whole process must restart with new materials.
Only the exposed assistant is replaced; continue using the materials.

title: Mixing solutions from two sources
vignette: They combine liquid from two approved sources for the cleansing mixture.

options.text: Mixture is valid as long as both sources are approved.
Use a single source to avoid doubts.

title: Application performed by a trainee
vignette: A young trainee applies the cleansing solution on a contaminated person.

options.text: It is valid if supervised.
A trainee may not perform the procedure at all.

title: Materials lost and replaced
vignette: Most of the original prepared materials were accidentally spilled and lost.

options.text: Prepare new materials to replenish the supply.
Use what remains and supplement with ordinary solution.

title: Application performed on the wrong day
vignette: The contaminated person was treated on day two instead of day three.

options.text: Repeat the application on the proper days.
Accept it; timing is less critical.

title: Using collected rainwater in a cistern
vignette: Instead of spring water, they have rain collected in a lined pit.

options.text: Rainwater works if the cistern is sealed and clean.
Only running spring water is valid.

title: Supervisor mixes materials without gloves
vignette: The officiating supervisor forgets gloves while combining the materials and solution.

options.text: It remains valid; gloves are merely precautionary.
Contact invalidates the mixture; discard and restart.

title: Materials transported outside designated zone
vignette: Some materials are taken to distant communities outside the designated area.

options.text: Permitted to help those far away.
They must remain in designated zone only.

title: Test animal purchased with stolen funds
vignette: Later it turns out the community money used to buy the test animal was embezzled.

options.text: Animal is invalid; acquire a new one with honest funds.
Use it anyway; the animal itself is fine.
